newsitem.title: SPAIN: SOCCER-BETIS BEAT TENERIFE TO TAKE SECOND FROM BARCELONA.
newsitem.headline: SOCCER-BETIS BEAT TENERIFE TO TAKE SECOND FROM BARCELONA.

text.p: Real Betis moved to second place in the Spanish championship on Saturday after coming home from a rain-soaked game at UEFA Cup semi-finalists Tenerife with a 1-0 win.

Betis scored from a deflected shot by Juan Canas midway through the first half and move two points ahead of Barcelona, who play Athletic Bilbao on Sunday. Although Real Madrid seem to be out of reach eight points ahead of Betis, the fight for second is important as it will give access to the European Cup.
Tenerife's best chance came when Juanele Castanos blasted a second-half penalty against the bar after Meho Kodro had been brought down by Betis keeper Toni Prats.
The bad news for Betis was that striker Alfonso Perez picked up his fifth booking of the season, and will serve out an automatic suspension in the next league game.
